CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 18, 1947, pg. 19, reads: "On Her Own - Verna White, willowy young songstress, is now carrying her vocal torch alone. She formerly sang with Thay Whitely's orchestra. Verna measures up to all that appeals to the eye and ears. She is a native of Pittsburgh. Wolves beware. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Verna White wearing dark one-shoulder top and posed leaning on wooden bench in front of dark curtain, in Harris Studio
